title: Revealing 3D Defect Structure in van der Waals Ferroelectric α-In2Se3 via Multislice Electron Ptychography
content: As we approach nanoscale limits in device engineering, understanding the local structure of defects and their influence on the electronic structure and performance of functional materials becomes increasingly more critical. This is particularly true for van der Waals ferroelectric material α-In2Se3. α-In2Se3 has seen a rise in interest in recent years due to its stable polarization down to nanometer thickness [1] and promising applications for nanoelectronic devices [2]. Previous works have discussed the theoretical electronic structure of point defects in α-In2Se3, where defects dictate not only doping behavior, but also influence polarization of the material [3]. In conventional STEM imaging, resolving atomic structure of complex defects in projection remains challenging. Multislice electron ptychography has emerged as promising computational technique to address this, enabling few-nanometer resolution depth-sectioning for imaging along the z-axis while offering x,y-resolution improved past the diffraction limit [4].
